# Sorting: Bubble Sort

Consider the following version of Bubble Sort:

<pre>
for (int i =0; i < n; i++) {

    for (int j = 0; j < n - 1; j++) {
        // Swap adjacent elements if they are in decreasing order
        if (a[j] > a[j + 1]) {
            swap(a[j], a[j + 1]);
        }
    }

}
</pre>

Given an array of integers, sort the array in ascending order using the _Bubble Sort_ algorithm above. Once sorted, print the following three lines:

**Hint:** To complete this challenge, you must add a variable that keeps a running tally of _all_ swaps that occur during execution. 

**Example**

```
swap    a       
0       [6,4,1]

2       [4,1,6]
3       [1,4,6]
```

The steps of the bubble sort are shown above.  It took <svg xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" width="1.162ex" height="2.176ex" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex;" viewBox="0 -791.3 500.5 936.9" role="img" focusable="false"><g stroke="currentColor" fill="currentColor" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><path stroke-width="1" d="M127 463Q100 463 85 480T69 524Q69 579 117 622T233 665Q268 665 277 664Q351 652 390 611T430 522Q430 470 396 421T302 350L299 348Q299 347 308 345T337 336T375 315Q457 262 457 175Q457 96 395 37T238 -22Q158 -22 100 21T42 130Q42 158 60 175T105 193Q133 193 151 175T169 130Q169 119 166 110T159 94T148 82T136 74T126 70T118 67L114 66Q165 21 238 21Q293 21 321 74Q338 107 338 175V195Q338 290 274 322Q259 328 213 329L171 330L168 332Q166 335 166 348Q166 366 174 366Q202 366 232 371Q266 376 294 413T322 525V533Q322 590 287 612Q265 626 240 626Q208 626 181 615T143 592T132 580H135Q138 579 143 578T153 573T165 566T175 555T183 540T186 520Q186 498 172 481T127 463Z"></path></g></svg> swaps to sort the array.  Output is:

<pre>

</pre>

**Function Description**

Complete the function _countSwaps_ in the editor below.  

countSwaps has the following parameter(s):

* _int a[n]:_ an array of integers to sort  

**Prints**

Print the three lines required, then return.  No return value is expected.  

**Input Format**

**Explanation 0**   
The array is already sorted, so <svg xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" width="1.162ex" height="2.176ex" style="vertical-align: -0.338ex;" viewBox="0 -791.3 500.5 936.9" role="img" focusable="false"><g stroke="currentColor" fill="currentColor" stroke-width="0" transform="matrix(1 0 0 -1 0 0)"><path stroke-width="1" d="M96 585Q152 666 249 666Q297 666 345 640T423 548Q460 465 460 320Q460 165 417 83Q397 41 362 16T301 -15T250 -22Q224 -22 198 -16T137 16T82 83Q39 165 39 320Q39 494 96 585ZM321 597Q291 629 250 629Q208 629 178 597Q153 571 145 525T137 333Q137 175 145 125T181 46Q209 16 250 16Q290 16 318 46Q347 76 354 130T362 333Q362 478 354 524T321 597Z"></path></g></svg> swaps take place.
